definition:
A module $Q$ is an [*injective module*]{} if it satisfies the following
equivalent conditions:

\(a) Every short exact sequence of the form $0 \to Q \to B \to C \to 0$
is ;

\(b) The functor ${\rm Hom}(-, Q)$ is ;

\(c) If $f : X \to Y$ is a monomorphism and there exists a homomorphism
$g : X \to Q$, then there exists a homomorphism $h : Y \to Q$ such that
$hf = g$. $$\xymatrix{
  0
        \ar[r]
  &
  X
        \ar[d]_g
        \ar[r]^f
  &
  Y
        \ar@{-->}[dl]^h
  \\
  &
  Q
}$$
